t: Amazon.com : GNARBOX - Portable Backup & Editing System for Any Camera, 128GB : Electronics
s: This was a problem when it came to basic video management.The Gnarbox has solved that in one go, even allowing me to edit in 4K to boot. Mine is the smaller 128gb version but I have paired it with a popular brand mini 500gb SSD which solves that issue and takes up no space to speak of.

t: Amazon.com: GNARBOX 2.0 SSD (1TB) - Rugged Backup Device for Your Camera : Electronics
s: Quickly manage backups without a phone or tablet using GNARBOX 2.0 SSD's on-board screen and buttons. Get peace of mind with checksum verifications. And with your own Folder Presets, you'll have instantly organized backups.

t: PSA: GNARBOX seems to be gone, leaving would-be GNARBOX customers out in the cold: Digital Photography Review
s: January 5, 2022 - The GNARBOX 2.0 SSD is an impressive device. However, it requires an app to function at its best. That app is no longer available, and it appears the company behind the product no longer exists. Buyer beware.

t: Check out this Amazon review of GNARBOX 2.0 SSD (1TB) - Rugged Backup Device for Your Camera
s: If you read the description of the Gnarbox 2.0 you will see that in addition to being a very fast SSD drive it is also a computer that fits in the palm of your hand, runs off a long-lasting user replaceable Li battery, and is capable of transcoding and adding metadata to videos and photos.

t: GNARBOX May Be Dead, So Buyer Beware | PetaPixel
s: August 23, 2023 - The popular backup device GNARBOX may be dead after the iOS app was pulled and the company has gone completely dark.

t: r/photography on Reddit: GNARBOX 2.0 SSD: The rugged backup device for content creators who prefer to travel without a laptop
s: April 3, 2018 - 3.5 stars on Amazon. ... I wonder if the copy/write issues is due to people using old/low quality SD cards. ... Entirely possible. ... its not. i tried everything from brand new UHS-II cards to extreme sandisk UHS-I cards and the thing is still an absolute mess. I however have been a V1 GNARBOX ...
